On july 14, 2012
MJ99

'Sup guys!MJ here,with my own little version of RPG!Yup,a RPGception!Let's see do you like it.Here is game help.

STORY
A group of nomads,on one of their travels,stumbled upon a small village of Strifinham,where peaceful people lived,but owned by a bandit clan named Black Sun Clan.They demand a tax to once independent village and they torture its inhabitants.Nomads decided to stay in the village,pay the tax,and try to defeat Black Sun clan and save poor village of Strifinham!

WORLD MAP
Map of the Strifinham Valley

BASIC GAMEPLAY
Players have their turn they get daily.Turns cannot be accumulated,so if one doesn't spend its turn for the day,too bad.Turn is restored exactly 24 hours from his post,so if it says that he posted it at 17:38,his next turn will be in the same time tomorrow.In one turn one can eat,drink,battle,move,go to a shop,etc...Players can buy turn potions from an alchemist,though.

CLASSES AND OCCUPATIONS

There are several different classes:
Soldier (Skilled in melee)
Ranger (Skilled in ranged)
Scout (+ agility,lesser ranged skill)
Shieldman (+ defense,lesser melee skill)
Fire Mage (Skilled in Fire Magic)
Frost Mage (Skilled in Frost Magic)
Lightning Mage (Skilled in Lightning Magic)
Healer (low in all skills,but can heal self and others)

There are also different occupations:
Merchant (Sells food,drink,and non-metal wares)
Blacksmith (Sells metal wares)
Hunter (Can kill wildlife and sell meat)
Librarian (Sells skill tomes)
Alchemist (Sells potions)
Bandit (Can enter houses and steal)
Builder (Gets paid to build houses)
Assassin (Gets paid to kill people)
Upon start,player can choose its class and occupation.He gets a starting item for what he chooses.Choose must be wise,because they cannot alter their choose while in-game.Default shopkeepers in Strifinham are merchant,blacksmith and alchemist.They sell most basic things players need to begin.Other things players must buy from other players.Human merchants can set their own prices,but must first find the item before being able to sell it,so they fill their own stock.Every player gets 100 coins on the beginning.

OVERVIEW
Before every turn,one must always write their current status. E.g.

Mladjone,level 1
Class: Shieldman
Occupation: Librarian
HP:10
Money:60
Inventory: Leather shield, Tunic and fabric boots
etc.
It's boring to write it everytime,so they better copy it into wordpad file and tweak it every turn.

LEVELS
Player can level up by doing quests and battling,so that he gets experience.Every level up they get one heart of maxHP (Starting with 10),and they get to choose will they upgrade attack,defense,or agility.Max level is 40.

INTERACTION
Players can interact with their fellows.They can talk to them,heal them,sell/buy form their shop,brawl with them,assassinate them,rob them,give them items,etc...But only if they are in same location.Players can declare other players friends or enemies,but they must write it in their overview.

SKILLS
Doing quests or using skill tomes,players can learn skills such as Whirlwind slash,or Frost Flurry.Every class has its own skills.Skill tomes can be bought from a Librarian.

COMBAT
Combat occurs everytime you change location,usually with a wild beast or a monster,depending on your location and level.When in combat,you use your currently equipped weapon and armor.Opponents take turns depending on their attributes,such as attack or defense.Example of some monsters:

Forest Critter
HP:3
Attack:2
Defense:0
Agility:3

Desert Rat
HP:5
Attack:3
Defense:1
Agility:2

Troll
HP:15
Attack:5
Defense:4
Agility:0

Black Sun Bandit
HP:18
Attack:4
Defense:3
Agility:5

Commander Cyrus (Boss)
HP:45
Attack:18
Defence:14
Agility:11

Attack decides how much hearts you take,and defense decides how much hearts you deflect from opponent's attack.Agility decides the chance of evading the attack.Attacker always has the first turn.

And,cuz i'm the manager,i'll do every battle,so when you say:"I move to the pyramid" i'll tell you a complete battle report,and your prize and xp.Of course,don't forget to type and overview everytime you take your turn!That way others can track your progress and decide do they want to mess with ya.

Also,here are other shops so you know what can you buy.

Merchant:
Pork Chop (heals 2 hearts) 30
Bread (Heals 1 heart) 20
Hide Shield (DEF + 1) 45
Stone Longsword (ATK + 1) 50
Skill tome: Fireball (ATK + 1) 35
Hide Boots (DEF + 1) 45

Alchemist:
Potion of Minor Healing (+2 ) 20
Potion of the Attacker (ATK + 2 for a turn) 30
Potion of the Defender (DEF + 2 for a turn) 30
Potion of the Evader (AGL + 2 for a turn) 30
Lesser Poison (-1 a turn,for 3 turns) 35

There you are!Now make your own characters and let's get playin'!

Also,guys,here's the update changelog:

UPDATES

Monsters now have a chance to drop an item,and a tiny chance to drop something rare e.g. Mythril Armor
Made the boss harder to beat,later today you'll get full list of all monsters,so you can see which monsters can you get.
You can choose to collect materials while in certain area e.g. if you are in forest,you can spend a turn to collect wood.Materials are used to build a house,and you need 5 wooden planks,5 stone brick,3 nails and 3 glass.All these can be crafted using rock from the mountains,wood from the forest,metal from the river and the sand from the desert.
Player shop is now limited to 5 items,and it can be carried everywhere,but you can make a stationary shop in Strifinham that can have 20 items in it.All the materials you need are as ones for the house.

As i said,you'll get complete list of Monsters later.

About the update...

UPDATE CHANGELOG

Dungeons are now in every area but they have limited chambers and a low chance of finding one.
While finding dungeons you may stumble upon a bandit camp or anything similar.
Chance to be hit by trap in dungeon is decreased with agility level e.g.
You stepped on a pressure plate that activated fire!
0 agility: 91 0-30 You will evade it 31-70 It will hit you and you will lose 3
1 agility: 65 0-35 You will evade it 36-70 It will hit you and you will lose 3
5 agility: 60 0-55 You will evade it 56-70 It will hit you and you will lose 3
And so on.

Hello again,and welcome to another update this time it's called

TIKI ORDER UPDATE

This update brings new profession,new skill,and most importantly,new map!

UPDATE CHANGELOG

New skill,Intelligence (INT) decides Critical hit chance. Everyone will get 1 INT so they have at least some chance to get a critical.
New profession: Guard,whose point is to get money for defeating assassins and bandits once they commit a crime.
New map, Tiki Shores,can be accessible from Crystal Pyramid by going to the west and it's a tropical belt of land. Even though the weather is beautiful and sand is warm, people form Cavati Tribe don't enjoy at all, as they are in grave danger. Go visit them and find out what is their problem... Now i'll explain all of the locations:

Desert Oasis: This is where go end up when you move west from Crystal Mountain.It's a great place for finding healthy food items.

Ancient Temple: Basically,a dungeon.

Dark Jungle: A heaven for hunters and scavengers.

Cavati Tribe Village: A main place to stay for all the Cavati Tribe Members.Go over there to buy and sell items.

Moonlight Docks: Nothing too special about this location,although there are future plans for it.

Leo's Tiki Hut: A cheerful guy Leo always has something to do. Just ask him and he might just have a suitable task for you.

It needs no pre-quest for entering. It's open right away. Enjoy new monsters and characters as you "relax" in this paradise.

On june 2, 2013
MJ99

Sorry guys, but tomorrow are the final exams that i must get an A on, so no time for this.
I will, however, answer your questions real quick, Mad.

- All you need is materials to craft as a blacksmith. Of course, you have to BE a Blacksmith, as no other occupation can do such a thing.

- No, getting a pickaxe and specifying that you'll use it in a search turn only increases your chances of finding ore. You can find it anyway, but it's more common at Coppermud River, Mountain of Trolls, Glacier Ruins and Ancient Temple than on the other places.

- Yes, you must go to town to smelt things, and it costs no money, but if you give some other Blacksmith to do it, it's his choice will he ask money for it or not (or will he even do it).

- Yes, you can build your shop, and it's the only way to actually sell your products. Every other way is considered peddling and is treated as a crime. So, if we get someone with a Guard occupation, you're gonna have a bad time. Also, you need certain building materials to make your shop, or any other shop. If you are interested, i can give you a complete list.

On june 4, 2013
MJ99

Ok, peeps, here's the list of all buildings you can make, and the materials required.

Small House
Use: +5 stationary inventory (you can access items only if that location)
3x Any Type Plank
3x Cobblestone

Large House
Use: +10 stationary inventory
5x Any Type Plank
5x Cobblestone

Merchant's Store (Merchants)
Use: Mercahnts can sell items here
2x Any Type Plank
3x Cobblestone
50x Gold

Blacksmith's Forge 9Blacksmiths)
Use: Blacksmith can sell weapons here
2x Any Type Plank
3x Cobblestone
2x Iron Ingot

Alchemist's Laboratory (Alchemists)
Use: Alchemists can sell potions here
2x Any Type Plank
2x Cobblestone
3x Any Herb

Library (Librarians)
Use: Librarians can sell Skill Tomes here
4x Any Type Plank
1x Cobblestone
1x Any Skill Tome

Healer's Hut (Healers)
Use: If the Healer's in town, everyone gets +1 when they arrive at the town
5x Any Type Plank
3x Cobblestone

Guard Tower (Guards)
Use: If a guard is in town there is a significantly higher chance that the criminal will be caught
5x Cobblestone
1x Iron Ingot

Dungeon
Use: If the guard catches a criminal, all of his actions are disabled (Without this a caught criminal cannot move and fight, but can search, possibly for his escape, so...)
4x Any Type Plank
4x Cobblestone
1x Steel Ingot

Hunter's Lodge (Hunters)
Use: Hunters can sell meat here
3x Any Type Plank
3x Any Meat

Sanctuary
Use: If this is built, Bandits and assassins have a higher chance of not getting caught
x6 Cobblestone
x1 Cloak of Darkness

Gallows
Use: All criminals caught are immediately killed (3 uses before rebuilding)
3x Any Type Plank

Fortress
Use: When moving to the town no monster fight will occur
7x Cobblestone
3x Iron Ingot

I think that's all. if anything changes on this list i will let you know. If you have any questions, you are free to ask them.

On june 4, 2013
MJ99

Sure, just look at my overview and modify it to fit your level and character. You have class and occupation info on the first page, but you should know some things:

All classes start with Tunic and Fabric Boots, except for mages, who start with robes of their respected color (Blue, Red, Yellow).

On level 1 you get 1 of every stat, but if you are a scout or a ranger you get 2 AGL but 0 DEF, if you are a shieldman you get 2 DEF but 0 ATK and if you are a Soldier you get 1 ATK and 0 AGL. If you are a healer you get 1 ATK 1 DEF 0 AGL, but an ability to heal outside of battle faster than the others. Mages have 1 of every stat, they are balanced.

Use icons if you can, it looks better and it is more functional to me as i can check your stats more easily.

Write down your mission at the end of your Overview, then i can remember what mission it was and keep track of your progress.

Save your overview in a Notepad file and when i give you a report, just open the file, tweak the Gold, HP, XP and the other things, and save. To make it a bunch easier for you, make your overview here, with all the icons, then simply copy the icon codes, too. So when you paste it back in the next day, the icons will automatically appear. Work with me.

If you have any more questions, feel free to ask me in a Private Message, i'll be more than willing to answer them.

Well, I'll be honest with you. This game works on a principle: "I feel like it", which means that when i say "random", i actually mean "The first thing that pops in my mind". I plan on implementing the randomness system in the game, so it becomes more fair if you don't trust me as a manager.

And, to answer your question. You won't really get any benefit form the idol whatsoever. Actually, you should consider it a burden, because it takes up a slot in your inventory, but does absolutely nothing. But don't worry. Collecting all of those idols will be worthwhile, because the Crystal Isle is a great place, lots of new monsters, quests, and a brand new Crystal tier armor and weapons. So be patient, and keep searchin' for them idols.

MJ99

Oh. Well that clever, I guess. Still, I prefer having my own randomness factor instead of letting everything be decided by RP Gadgets. You see, when I decide Criticals and other things like that in this game, I use a peculiar randomness factor that's hard to explain, but works perfectly. The only thing that this game lacks is a constant preview of rules. Every time a new thing is added, I have to post it as the latest post and it gets buried within the actual game content. Newcomers are never quite sure of what to do if they want to join, because the first page doesn't explain everything, plus there have been a lot of changes over the course of time. So that makes it even more confusing o everyone, which is one of the reasons I don't feel like managing this thread. Every turn there's a ton of error corrections, double-checks and typos, and it makes it confusing even for me, the guy who actually came up with the thing.
